headline: Tesla Is Headed to Saudi Arabia, Years After Infamous Tweet
summary: Saudi Arabia is getting  Tesla  Just not like investors imagined a few years ago.  Tesla vehicles aren’t available in every country on Earth, and expansion represents growth opportunities for the company.  Saudi Arabia has about 33 million people and a nominal gross domestic product per capita similar to South Korea’s. Annual car sales are in the range of 800,000 vehicles.

headline: 'The Company Is Fundamentally Sound'—Weeks Before Enron Imploded, Kenneth Lay Told Employees To Keep Buying Stock
summary: In the fall of 2001, as Enron’s internal problems mounted and its stock price tumbled, Chair Kenneth Lay told employees the opposite of what was really going on. “The company is fundamentally sound,” Lay said during a company-wide electronic forum on Sept. 26, 2001. “At current stock prices... this seems to be an incredibly cheap stock.” FLASHBACK: Kenneth Lay told Enron employees to hold onto to their stock and buy more in an all-hands meeting right before it crashed out. $ENE $TSLA https://t.c

headline: BYD Stock Rises. EV Maker Ramps Up Tesla Battle With Global Sales Drive.
summary: STOCKSTOWATCHTODAY BLOG   BYD just passed Tesla in revenue—and it looks like the Chinese company is about to go global in the battle for electric-vehicle supremacy. BYD chairman Wang Chuanfu told analysts on an earnings call Tuesday that the EV maker is aiming to sell 800,000 cars outside of China this year, according to Reuters, up from 417,204 in 2024.

headline: Ex-Tesla CFO Leads Employee-Rewards Startup’s Funding Round in First Major Venture Since Exit
summary: Former  Tesla  finance chief  Zach Kirkhorn  led a recent funding round in Jolly, a startup that aims to help companies improve employee productivity through rewards, and joined its board in his first major venture since leaving the automaker in 2023.  Kirkhorn served as the lead investor in Jolly’s $16.5 million Series A round in January, marking his first time leading funding for a company, and the board appointment signaled his continuing involvement with the startup that was founded in 2022 by a former Tesla intern, Dean Zimberg.  Kirkhorn stepped down as Tesla’s CFO in 2023, after four years as finance chief and 13 years at the company helping transform Tesla into the world’s most valuable carmaker.

headline: Tesla to launch in Saudi Arabia as Musk and the kingdom mend relations
summary: Tesla will start sales in Saudi Arabia next month, the electric carmaker said on its website, signalling CEO Elon Musk and the kingdom have healed a rift that dates back to the billionaire's short-lived bid in 2018 to take the company private.  The dispute started when Musk tweeted in 2018 he had "funding secured" to take Tesla private after meeting Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund.  That tweet eventually led to a lawsuit from investors when a bid failed to materialise, during which tense text messages between Musk and PIF head Yasir al-Rumayyan were made public.

raw.headline: Tesla to launch in Saudi Arabia as Musk and the kingdom mend relations
raw.summary: Tesla will start sales in Saudi Arabia next month, the electric carmaker said on its website, signalling CEO Elon Musk and the kingdom have healed a rift that dates back to the billionaire's short-lived bid in 2018 to take the company private.  The dispute started when Musk tweeted in 2018 he had "funding secured" to take Tesla private after meeting Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund.  That tweet eventually led to a lawsuit from investors when a bid failed to materialise, during which tense text messages between Musk and PIF head Yasir al-Rumayyan were made public.
